item.title: How to make an area a safe zone
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

absX >= 2527 && absX <= 2545 && absY >= 3031 && absY <= 3035

I suggest you don’t get into the habit of doing that.

private boolean isWithin(int minX, int maxX, int minY, int maxY)
{
    return absX >= minX && absX <= maxX && absY >= minY && absY <= maxY;
}

Read full topic
item.source: How to make an area a safe zone

item.title: How to make an area a safe zone
item.dc:creator: @sexy_slay sexy slay
item.description:
@sexy_slay wrote:

Ok, i’ll try to explain how, first you find the public boolean that i posted above, next
delete the stuff inside it and add this…

[code]public boolean nonWild() {
if ((absX >= 2527 && absX <= 2545 && absY >= 3031 && absY <= 3035)

            || heightLevel == 1) {
        return false;
    } else {
        return true;
    }
}[/code]

Ok this is going to hard to follow so i’ll explain,
the first absX >= is your south west corner X cordinate of the pk area.
The next absX >= is your north east corner X cordinate of the pk area

Next the abxY >= is your south west corner Y cordinate of the pk area.
The next abxY >= is your north east corner Y cordinate of the pk area.

Now to explain. When you delete all the stuff inside of the public boolean nonwild, it makes every where safe. So to add pk area’s you simply copy the code i gave you and impute the SW x corner cord, the NE corner X cord, and the same for the Y. This will make your pk areas pk , and your safe areas safe…
Hope i could help

Read full topic
